zone.line: O! happiness! who of your gifts
Such an advantage draw can.
The father shews you his boys
one
And every asks & throngs & presses
The fiddle ceases, the dancers stop
Thou goest, in the dance stand they
The caps fly on high
c
And little fails, so bend themselves .knee
To the coming of the venerable
Faust.
Now a little step yet out to this stone
Here will I we of our wanderings rest
Here sit I often thoughtful alone
And comfort myself with prayer & fast
In hope rich, in faith firm
With tears, sighs, wringing of hands,
Think ?I the end of this Plague
From the Lord of Heavens to obtain
like scorn
Of the multitude the lot sounds to me now
My father was a gloomy honoured Man
